intro: Hesperanthes albomarginata, commonly known as the white-margin daisies, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers with white petals and a yellow center. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in a fine layer of hairs. Hesperanthes albomarginata is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant blooms and adaptability to various soil types.
